intro: Ledothamnus luteus, commonly known as the yellow thamnophyllum, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Polygonaceae. It is characterized by its slender, creeping stems and small, clustered yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as woodland floors or along stream banks. Its leaves are lance-shaped and often have a reddish or purple hue when young. Ledothamnus luteus is valued for its ornamental appeal and its role in supporting local ecosystems.
